newsitem.title: JAPAN: Marubeni, U.S. firm to build 50 power plants - paper.
newsitem.headline: Marubeni, U.S. firm to build 50 power plants - paper.

text.p: Marubeni Corp and leading U.S. electricity wholesaler Sithe Energies Inc are to jointly invest $2 billion to build about 50 power plants mainly in Asia, a business daily reported on Wednesday.
A Marubeni spokesman was not immediately available for comment on the report in the Nihon Keizai Shimbun.
As the first of the series of joint projects, the two companies plan to invest $175 million in building a power plant with a capacity of 100,000 kilowatts in Hebei Province in China, the paper said.
The companies have set up a joint venture firm with a local firm in China for the project, the paper said.
Construction of the power plant is expected to be completed in 1998, it said.
Marubeni and the U.S. power producer also plan to bid for about 30 power plant projects in other Asian countries including Indonesia and Thailand, the paper said.
They plan to build other plants in North America and Central and South America.
Other Japanese trading houses, including Itochu Corp and Mitsui & Co, have similar joint projects with British and U.S. power companies, the paper said.
